body: Maybe it is the meshing going on in the background that makes it slow in Hbee- it can take a long time in DIVA, too, depending on the meshing level; you should be able to put the DIVA output *.rad file into the HBee-generated octree, including whatever materials you assigned in DIVA - if the scene positions line up. Doesn't Hbee even have an "import rad" component? Otherwise modify the simulation bat files to feed your D-generated rad into the oct package.
